name: PM-KISAN Samman Nidhi
description: Direct income support of Rs 6,000 per year to farmer families in 3 equal installments of Rs 2,000 each. Funds transferred directly to bank account via DBT.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: Rs 6,000/year (3 installments of Rs 2,000)

steps: Visit pmkisan.gov.in
Click New Farmer Registration
Enter Aadhaar number and get OTP
Fill land details, bank details and personal information
Submit and note registration number
application_process.offline: Visit nearest CSC (Common Service Centre) or Agriculture Office

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
description: Comprehensive crop insurance scheme covering yield losses due to non-preventable natural risks. Premium: 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi, 5% for commercial/horticultural crops. Balance premium paid by government.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: Full sum insured based on scale of finance (varies by crop and district)

steps: Visit pmfby.gov.in or nearest bank branch
Fill application form with crop and land details
Pay premium amount (2% Kharif / 1.5% Rabi)
Collect policy receipt
In case of loss, inform within 72 hours via app or helpline
application_process.offline: Through bank, CSC center, or insurance company agent

name: Kisan Credit Card
description: Provides farmers with timely and adequate credit for agricultural operations, allied activities and consumption needs. Interest rate of 7% p.a. with 3% subvention for timely repayment (effective 4%). Credit limit based on land holding and crop pattern.
ministry: Ministry of Finance / NABARD
benefit_amount: Credit limit up to Rs 3 lakh at 4% interest (with subvention)
required_documents: Caste certificate (if applicable for additional benefits)

steps: Visit nearest bank branch (Commercial/Cooperative/RRB)
Collect KCC application form
Submit filled form with land and identity documents
Bank processes and fixes credit limit
Receive KCC card with ATM facility
application_process.offline: Apply at nearest bank branch with documents

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
description: Provides soil health cards to farmers with crop-wise recommendations for nutrients and fertilizers based on soil testing. Cards issued every 2 years. Helps farmers optimize fertilizer use and improve soil health.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: Free soil testing and advisory services

steps: Visit soilhealth.dac.gov.in or contact Agriculture Department
Provide land details and location
Soil samples collected by trained personnel
Testing done at Soil Testing Laboratory
Soil Health Card with recommendations delivered
application_process.offline: Contact Block Agriculture Officer or Krishi Vigyan Kendra

name: e-NAM (National Agriculture Market)
description: Pan-India electronic trading portal linking APMCs (mandis) across states. Enables farmers to sell produce online to best bidder, ensuring transparent price discovery and reducing middlemen. Over 1000 mandis integrated.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: Better price realization through competitive bidding (no direct subsidy)

steps: Register at enam.gov.in or at the mandi office
Get unique farmer ID
Bring produce to e-NAM enabled mandi
Produce quality assessed and uploaded online
Traders bid online, farmer accepts best price
Payment transferred to bank within 3 days
application_process.offline: Register at nearest e-NAM enabled APMC mandi

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana
description: Promotes organic farming through adoption of organic village clusters. Provides financial assistance of Rs 50,000 per hectare over 3 years for organic inputs, certification, and marketing. Groups of 50 farmers form a cluster of 50 acres minimum.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: Rs 50,000/hectare over 3 years (Rs 31,000 for organic inputs to farmer)
required_documents: Willingness to adopt organic farming for minimum 3 years

steps: Form a group of minimum 50 farmers (50 acres cluster)
Contact District Agriculture Officer
Submit cluster proposal through state agriculture department
Approval and release of funds in installments
Adopt organic practices and get PGS certification
application_process.offline: Apply through District Agriculture Officer or ATMA

name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana
description: Provides states with flexibility to plan and execute agriculture development programs based on local needs. Supports infrastructure, innovation, agri-entrepreneurship, and value chain development. Renamed as RKVY-RAFTAAR with focus on agri-business incubation.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: Project-based funding (varies by state proposal)

steps: State prepares District/State Agriculture Plan
Projects approved by State Level Sanctioning Committee
Funds released through State Agriculture Department
Implementation through line departments and agencies
Individual entrepreneurs apply through RKVY-RAFTAAR portal for incubation support
application_process.offline: Through State Agriculture Department and District Agriculture Officer

name: PM-KUSUM (Kisan Urja Suraksha evam Utthaan Mahabhiyan)
description: Promotes solar energy in agriculture. Three components: (A) 10,000 MW solar plants on barren land, (B) 20 lakh standalone solar pumps, (C) Solarization of 15 lakh grid-connected pumps. 60% subsidy on solar pumps (30% Central + 30% State), 30% bank loan, 10% farmer share.
ministry: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
benefit_amount: 60% subsidy on solar pump cost (farmer pays only 10%)
required_documents: Existing electricity connection details (for Component C)

steps: Visit mnre.gov.in/kusum or state DISCOM website
Register and submit application online
Select solar pump capacity as per requirement
Pay farmer share (10% of cost)
State agency installs solar pump
application_process.offline: Apply through State DISCOM office or block-level energy department

name: Micro Irrigation Fund
description: NABARD-operated fund with corpus of Rs 5,000 crore to facilitate states in mobilizing resources for expanding micro irrigation (drip and sprinkler) coverage. Provides loans at concessional interest to states for micro irrigation projects.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare / NABARD
benefit_amount: 55% subsidy for small/marginal farmers, 45% for others on drip/sprinkler systems

steps: Contact District Horticulture/Agriculture Officer
Submit application with land and water source details
Field verification by department officials
Select equipment from empaneled suppliers
Pay farmer share and claim subsidy
Installation and verification
application_process.offline: Apply at District Agriculture/Horticulture Office

name: NABARD Rural Infrastructure Development Fund
name_hindi: NABARD Gramin Aadharboot Sanrachna Vikas Nidhi
description: Provides loans to state governments for rural infrastructure including irrigation, rural roads, bridges, rural drinking water, soil conservation, flood protection and watershed management. Supports agriculture sector indirectly through infrastructure.
ministry: NABARD / Ministry of Finance
benefit_amount: Concessional loans for state infrastructure projects (varies by project)

steps: State government identifies project requirement
Prepares Detailed Project Report (DPR)
Submits proposal to NABARD Regional Office
NABARD appraises and sanctions loan
Funds disbursed in tranches against progress
application_process.offline: Through State Government to NABARD

name: Agricultural Technology Management Agency
description: District-level autonomous body for technology dissemination. Provides training, demonstrations, exposure visits, and farm schools for farmers. Supports Farmer Interest Groups (FIGs) and Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs). Integrates extension activities at district level.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: Free training, demonstrations, and exposure visits (travel and food allowance provided)

steps: Contact Block Technology Manager (BTM) at Block Agriculture Office
Register as farmer with ATMA
Participate in farmer meetings and training programs
Form or join Farmer Interest Group (FIG)
Avail training, demos, and exposure visits
application_process.offline: Contact ATMA at District Agriculture Office or Block Technology Manager

name: National Food Security Mission
description: Aims to increase production of rice, wheat, pulses, coarse cereals and commercial crops through area expansion, productivity improvement and quality seed distribution. Provides subsidies on seeds, farm machinery, plant protection, soil ameliorants.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: 50% subsidy on certified seeds, 50% on plant protection chemicals, 40% on farm machinery (up to defined limits)

steps: Contact Block Agriculture Officer
Submit application for desired component (seeds/machinery/inputs)
Verification by field staff
Receive subsidized inputs or DBT credit to bank account
Follow recommended package of practices
application_process.offline: Apply at Block Agriculture Office

name: National Mission for Sustainable Agriculture
description: Promotes sustainable agriculture through climate-resilient practices. Covers rainfed area development, on-farm water management, soil health management, and climate change adaptation. Integrates multiple components for holistic sustainable agriculture.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: 50-100% subsidy on soil amendments, water harvesting structures, organic inputs (varies by component)

steps: Identify relevant NMSA component (rainfed area/water management/soil health)
Contact District Agriculture/Soil Conservation Officer
Submit application with required documents
Field verification and approval
Implementation and subsidy release
application_process.offline: Apply through District Agriculture/Soil Conservation Office

name: Agri-Clinics and Agri-Business Centres Scheme
name_hindi: Krishi Clinic evam Krishi Vyapar Kendra Yojana
description: Supports agriculture graduates and diploma holders to set up agri-clinics for advisory services or agri-business ventures. Provides free 60-day training, 44% subsidy on bank loans (36% for general category), and handholding support.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare / MANAGE
benefit_amount: 44% subsidy (36% general) on project cost up to Rs 20 lakh for individuals, Rs 1 crore for groups of 5
required_documents: Training completion certificate from MANAGE-recognized institute

steps: Register at acabcmis.gov.in
Attend free 60-day Agri-Clinics training at nearest Nodal Training Institute
Prepare Detailed Project Report (DPR)
Apply for bank loan at any commercial/cooperative bank
Receive 44% (or 36%) back-end capital subsidy on loan
Start agri-clinic/business
application_process.offline: Contact MANAGE Hyderabad or nearest agricultural university

name: Sub-Mission on Seed and Planting Material
name_hindi: Beej evam Ropan Samgri par Upa-Mission
description: Aims to increase production and availability of quality seeds and planting material. Supports seed production, quality assurance, seed village programme, and creation of seed infrastructure. Subsidized seeds of improved varieties made available.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: 50-75% subsidy on certified/foundation seeds of new varieties

steps: Contact Block/District Agriculture Office at start of cropping season
Register demand for certified seeds of recommended varieties
Receive subsidized seeds through government supply chain
Grow seed crop under guidance (for seed village programme)
Report on crop performance
application_process.offline: Contact District/Block Agriculture Office or Seed Corporation

name: National Horticulture Mission
description: Now part of Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture (MIDH). Provides end-to-end support for horticulture development including planting material, area expansion, protected cultivation, organic farming, PHM, and marketing infrastructure.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: 40-75% subsidy on planting material, drip irrigation, polyhouse, cold storage, pack house (varies by component and farmer category)

steps: Contact District Horticulture Officer
Submit application for desired component (area expansion/protected cultivation/PHM)
Field verification by department staff
Approval by District/State Level Committee
Implementation and subsidy release via DBT
application_process.offline: Apply at District Horticulture Office

name: PM Matsya Sampada Yojana
description: Flagship scheme for fisheries development. Supports fish production, infrastructure modernization, quality improvement, and fishermen welfare. Provides subsidies for fish farming ponds, hatcheries, feed mills, cold chains, and fishing vessels.
ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying
benefit_amount: 40-60% subsidy on pond construction, feed, equipment (60% for SC/ST/Women, 40% for others)

steps: Visit pmmsy.dof.gov.in
Register and submit online application
Select desired component (pond/hatchery/equipment)
Submit required documents
Field verification and approval by District Fisheries Officer
Implementation and subsidy release
application_process.offline: Apply at District Fisheries Office

name: Agriculture Infrastructure Fund
description: Rs 1 lakh crore financing facility for post-harvest management and community farming assets. Provides 3% interest subvention on loans up to Rs 2 crore. Supports warehouse, cold storage, grading and sorting units, primary processing centers.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: 3% interest subvention on loans up to Rs 2 crore for 7 years + CGTMSE credit guarantee

steps: Visit agriinfra.dac.gov.in
Register as applicant (farmer/FPO/PACS/startup)
Upload project proposal and documents
Bank evaluates and sanctions loan
3% interest subvention credited automatically
CGTMSE guarantee covers collateral requirement
application_process.offline: Apply through any scheduled commercial bank, RRB, or cooperative bank

name: National Mission on Oilseeds and Oil Palm
name_hindi: Rashtriya Tilhan evam Tel Palm Mission
description: Aims to increase domestic production of oilseeds and oil palm to reduce edible oil imports. Supports production of soybean, groundnut, mustard, sunflower, sesame, and oil palm. Provides subsidies on seeds, inputs, mini oil mills, and oil palm planting material.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: 50% subsidy on seeds and inputs, Rs 250-29,000/ha for oil palm planting

steps: Contact District Agriculture Officer or Oil Palm Development Agency
Register for oilseed/oil palm scheme component
Receive subsidized seeds, inputs and planting material
For oil palm, contact designated company for planting material and buyback
application_process.offline: Apply through District Agriculture/Horticulture Office

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana
description: Ensures access to protective irrigation for every farm (Har Khet Ko Pani) and efficient water use (Per Drop More Crop). Covers creation of new water sources, repair of old ones, and promotion of micro irrigation.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture / Ministry of Jal Shakti
benefit_amount: 55% subsidy for micro irrigation (small/marginal farmers), 45% for others. Full funding for watershed development.

steps: Contact District Agriculture/Horticulture/Irrigation Office
Submit application for relevant component (micro irrigation/water source/watershed)
Field verification
Select equipment from empaneled suppliers (for micro irrigation)
Pay farmer share and avail subsidy
application_process.offline: Apply at District Agriculture or Irrigation Office

name: Interest Subvention Scheme for Agriculture
name_hindi: Krishi ke liye Byaj Riyayat Yojana
description: Provides 2% interest subvention to banks on short-term crop loans up to Rs 3 lakh. Farmers get loans at 7% (banks lend at 9%, get 2% subvention). Additional 3% prompt repayment incentive makes effective rate 4% for timely repayers.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare / RBI
benefit_amount: Effective interest rate of 4% on crop loans up to Rs 3 lakh (for prompt repayment)
required_documents: KCC card or crop loan account

steps: Avail crop loan through KCC from any bank
Repay within one year to get 3% additional rebate
Interest subvention automatically applied by bank
No separate application needed - linked to KCC/crop loan
application_process.offline: Automatic through KCC-linked bank account

name: National Bamboo Mission
description: Promotes holistic growth of bamboo sector through area expansion, improved production, and product development. Provides planting material, supports bamboo treatment plants, handicraft development, and marketing. Good supplementary income for farmers.
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
benefit_amount: 50% subsidy on planting material and production costs, up to Rs 120/plant for 3 years
required_documents: Land records showing availability for bamboo plantation

steps: Contact State Bamboo Mission or District Horticulture/Forest Office
Submit application for bamboo plantation
Receive quality planting material (tissue culture)
Plant and maintain as per guidelines
Subsidy released in installments over 3 years
application_process.offline: Apply through State Bamboo Mission or District Forest/Horticulture Office
